content: Thus says the :
I am going to stir up a destructive wind
against Babylon
and I will send winnowers to Babylon,
They shall empty her land
Let not the archer bend his bow,
Do not spare her young men;
They shall fall down slain in the land of the Chaldeans,
Israel and Judah have not been forsaken
though their land is full of guilt

Raise a standard against the walls of Babylon;
post sentinels;
for the  has both planned and done
You who live by mighty waters,
your end has come,
The  of hosts has sworn by himself:
Surely I will fill you with troops like a swarm of locusts,
Israel the Creator’s Instrument
You are my war club, my weapon of battle:
with you I smash nations;
with you I smash the horse and its rider;
with you I smash man and woman;
with you I smash the young man and the girl;
with you I smash farmers and their teams;
The Doom of Babylon
I will repay Babylon and all the inhabitants of Chaldea before your very eyes for all the wrong that they have done in Zion, says the .
Jeremiah’s Command to Seraiah

The word that the prophet Jeremiah commanded Seraiah son of Neriah son of Mahseiah, when he went with King Zedekiah of Judah to Babylon, in the fourth year of his reign. Seraiah was the quartermaster.
Jeremiah wrote in a scroll all the disasters that would come on Babylon, all these words that are written concerning Babylon.
And Jeremiah said to Seraiah: “When you come to Babylon, see that you read all these words,
and say, ‘O , you yourself threatened to destroy this place so that neither human beings nor animals shall live in it, and it shall be desolate forever.’
When you finish reading this scroll, tie a stone to it, and throw it into the middle of the Euphrates,
and say, ‘Thus shall Babylon sink, to rise no more, because of the disasters that I am bringing on her.’”Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.
